p: Taken together, SARS-coronaviruses inhibit a number of mitochondrial antiviral defense mechanisms, including the reduction of interferon activation. It is known that pretreatment with interferon I/III is beneficial in SARS-CoV infection, but the protective effect may be even higher in SARS-CoV-2 ( Vabret etÂ al., 2020), suggesting similar or aggravated impairment of interferon activation in COVID-19.
